feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Boy's murder in Nepal a 'human sacrifice', eleven arrested
entry.summary: Police have arrested 11 villagers over the murder of a 10-year-old boy in southwestern Nepal, in what authorities are calling a case of human sacrifice.

entry.title: Boy's murder in Nepal a 'human sacrifice', eleven arrested
Nepal's Mt. Annapurna trails deemed safe after April earthquake
entry.summary:
The most popular trekking trail in Nepal escaped damage during April's devastating earthquake and is safe for hikers to return, an assessment team said Thursday.

Nepal is hoping visitors will return in September, when tourist season begins.

Tulsi Prasad Gautam of Nepal's Tourism Department said the assessment would help bring back trekkers, and it would be easier for them to get travel insurance - a major concern for people planning their trip to Nepal.

The trail around Mount Annapurna gets about 115,000 foreign trekkers, which is about 60 per cent of all hikers who travel to Nepal every year.

entry.title: Hiking trails around Annapurna deemed safe after Nepal quake
Protesters demanding that Nepal become a Hindu nation throw chairs at deputy prime minister
entry.summary:
KATHMANDU, Nepal - Protesters demanding that Nepal be turned back into a Hindu nation scuffled with police and threw chairs at the country's deputy prime minister when he was collecting suggestions on a draft constitution.

Nepal has been governed by an interim constitution for seven years.

entry.title: Protesters Throw Chairs at Nepal's Deputy Prime Minister
Quake-hit Nepal urges other nations to lift travel advisories, hopes to bring back tourists
entry.summary: Tourism is a key source of foreign currency for Nepal, which has many of the world's tallest mountains, including Mount Everest.

entry.title: Quake-hit Nepal asks other nations to lift travel advisories
entry.summary: Nepal's government has urged other countries to lift travel advisories that discourage their citizens from visiting the Himalayan nation following a devastating earthquake in April that killed thousands of people.

entry.title: Quake-hit Nepal asks other nations to lift travel advisories
Nepal hospital, CNN differ on reported surgery after quake
entry.summary: KATHMANDU, Nepal (AP) - A Nepal hospital said Friday that CNN medical correspondent Dr. Sanjay Gupta incorrectly reported that he operated on an 8-year-old girl after the country's devastating earthquake in April.

entry.title: Image of Asia: Repairing Earthquake Damage in Nepal
Image of Asia: Celebrating While Planting Paddy in Nepal
Image of Asia: Celebrating while planting paddy in Nepal
entry.summary: In this photo by Niranjan Shrestha, farmers play with sludge as they plant paddy saplings in a field outside Kathmandu, Nepal, on Asar Pandhra day.
